clinical_study.brief_title: Comparative Assessment of Utilization of Antiviral Therapies in Hepatitis C and Effectiveness of Daclatasvir-containing Regimens in Real-life Clinical Care in Europe (CMPASS-EU)
clinical_study.official_title: Comparative Assessment of Utilization of Antiviral Therapies in Hepatitis C and Effectiveness of Daclatasvir-containing Regimens in Real-life Clinical Care in Europe

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to collect information on the current treatment patterns for Hepatitis C in participating countries. There is also a focus on patients receiving a daclatasvir-containing treatment regimen who will be followed prospectively for 12 months after treatment initiation to collect real-world data on effectiveness and safety of the treatment. Additional analysis will differentiate between selected subpopulations.

primary_outcome.measure: Quantify effectiveness of daclatasvir (DCV) containing regimen overall and in subgroups (GT1, non GT1 and cirrhotic patients) by measuring sustained virologic response (SVR12)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Upto week 12 after the end of HCV treatment (SVR12)
primary_outcome.description: SVR12 defined as a documented undetectable viral load on or after week 12 following the end of treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: SVR12 in patients treated with DCV-containing regimens in real-life by treatment regimen, genotype, cirrhosis stage, HCV-treatment experience, HIV coinfection, and previous LTx (if present)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upto week 12 after the end of HCV treatment (SVR12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of patients on DCV-containing regimens achieving SVR12 in real-life compared with SVR12 rates in clinical trials
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upto week 12 after the end of HCV treatment (SVR12)

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety of DCV-containing regimens in real-life measured by the incidence of (S)AEs and the incidence leading to treatment discontinuation

Demographic and clinical characteristics and treatment patterns of patients starting a new HCV treatment regimen (with or without DCV), overall and by treatment regimen,GT,cirrhosis stage,HCV-treatment experience,HIV co-infection,and previous LTx

Comparison of demographic and clinical characteristics of patients starting a new HCV treatment regimen (with or without DCV) by treatment regimen and to identify factors associated with the initiation of different regimens

SVR 24 in patients treated with DCV-containing regimens in real-life clinical care, change of Child-Pugh Score and Metavir score as well as change of patient related outcomes (EQ-5D and SF-36 questionnaires measuring quality of life)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Upto week 24 after the end of HCV treatment (SVR24)

arm_group.arm_group_label: Patients treated with and without exposure

study_pop.textblock: Patients from private practices and outpatients units in hospitals
